message.content:
A 'Charadrius nivosus' is a small shorebird species belonging to the family Charadriidae. It is commonly referred to as the snowy plover due to its snowy-white underparts.
The snowy plover has a pale brown upperparts with blackish-brown patches on its wings. It has a brownish-black bill, legs, and feet.
The snowy plover measures 15-17 cm in length and weighs around 40-60 grams.
It has a roundish head with a black band stretching from its eye to its forehead.
The snowy plover is mostly found in sandy beaches along the Atlantic and Pacific coasts of North America, Mexico, and the Caribbean.
It is listed as a threatened species due to habitat loss, human disturbance, and predation by introduced species.
The snowy plover feeds on small crustaceans, insects, and other invertebrates that it finds along the shoreline.
